channel.title: My runserver thing is fucked again
channel.description: I have had this answered before. And I fixed it. But It's happening.. Again... I go runserver And it says java.c is not recognised and an internall... and it closes the box 0.005 seconds after :mad: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/getStarted/problems/index.html I read that and I can't enter the command promt...

item.title: My runserver thing is fucked again
item.dc:creator: @Slivion Slivion
item.description:
@Slivion wrote:

Open up Start,
Right click My Computer,
Select Properties,
Go to the Advanced tab,
Select Environmental Variables,
On System Variables,
Add New,

Variable Name: CLASSPATH Variable Value: Files\Java\jre1.5.0_0(JreVersionHere)\bin\javaw.exe

Try that.

Read full topic

item.source: My runserver thing is fucked again

item.title: My runserver thing is fucked again
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Haiku, he needs to set classpaths, he doesn’t need a compiler. Anyways to set classpaths go to start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced the enviromental variables. Start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables. Now find the variable called “path”, rename it to “PATH” and for it’s variable value put this "C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”. Make a new variable and give it the name classpath and add this in it for it’s value “C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”. Do not delete the "'s in the values, delete them in the name of the paths, so the “PATH” is PATH.

Read full topic

item.title: My runserver thing is fucked again
item.dc:creator: @Haiku01 Haiku01
item.description:
@Haiku01 wrote:

[code]@echo off
COLOR 4
TITLE Menu

:menu
CLS
ECHO Server menu
ECHO The ULTIMATE MENU
ECHO.
ECHO Type 1 to compile and run!
ECHO Type 2 to run!
ECHO Type 3 to compile!
ECHO Type 4 to Exit!
SET option=
ECHO.
SET /p option=Your Choice?
if %option%==1 goto compileandrunserver
if %option%==2 goto runserver
if %option%==3 goto compileserver
if %option%==4 exit
:compileandrunserver
CLS
title MF-PARADISE is compiling…
echo Compiling MF-PARADISE…
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
title Started MF-PARADISE…
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo Compiling MF-PARADISE. Complete…
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo Loading MF-PARADISE. Complete…
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo MF-PARADISE is fully compiled and loaded!
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
CLS
exit

:runserver
CLS
TITLE Started MF-PARADISE
ECHO MF-PARADISE is being started…
ECHO ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
CLS

:compileserver
CLS
title MF-PARADISE compiling…
echo Compiling MF-PARADISE…
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
echo Compiling complete…
echo ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
echo.
echo.
echo Type 1 to run the server!
echo Type 2 to go to the menu!
echo Type 3 to exit!
echo.
SET optioncompile=
SET /p optioncompile=What do you want to do now?
if %optioncompile%==1 goto runserver
if %optioncompile%==2 goto menu
if %optioncompile%==3 exit[/code]

That is my last server compiler and runner, right-click runserver, click edit. Delete everything and paste this in it. SAve and try.

NOTE-I just got it might not work for you.

Read full topic
